content: neat mitered squares this is my own version of the very known mitered squares when i decided to make a mitered squares blanket to use up my leftovers of yarn i made a research and found out dozens of patterns many of them were excellent but no one was perfect for my taste so i ended up writing my own of course many of its features can be found in other patterns too but not combined as far as i know at least i hope you ll like it needles you can use circulars double-pointed or straight needles as you prefer anyway since the blanket is knitted in one piece it becomes less and less comfortable to knit with straight needles as the piece grows my personal favourites are 60 cm 24 in circulars size depends from the yarn you re using yarn any yarn will do as this patterns is basically a stashbuster you ll only need a few grams of yarn for every square construction the blanket is built in one piece after knitting the first square you ll need to pick up some stitches along and that will become the cast on for the next one abbreviations st sts stitch stitches k knit p purl sl slip sl1kw slip one stitch knitwise sl1pw slip one stitch purlwise sl2kwtog slip two stitches together knitwise psso pass slipped stitch over in this case it s actually two sts the ones you slipped together k3tog knit three stitches together pattern by susanna locati ©arachnecrafts first square the square is quite simple a garter stitch block with a double decrease at the centre of every right side row when working the wrong side the central stitch is purled instead of knitted this creates a nice sharp diagonal line on the right side the selvedge is worked slipping knitwise the first stitch of every row and purling the last one it will look like a chain and it will make far easier and neater the picking up cast on 41 sts using the cable cast on if you want you can choose another odd number of stitches to start with 41 sts and dk yarn i get a nice square of about 10 x 10
